{{cpp/title|atan{{small|(std::valarray)}}}}
{{cpp/numeric/valarray/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=valarray|1=
template&lt; class T &gt;
valarray&lt;T&gt; atan( const valarray&lt;T&gt;&amp; va );
}}

For each element in {{c|va}} computes arc tangent of the value of the element. 

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|va|value array to apply the operation to}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
Value array containing arc tangents of the values in {{c|va}}.

===Notes===
{{cpp/numeric/valarray/notes unq|atan}}

{{cpp/numeric/valarray/notes ret|atan}}

===Possible implementation===
{{cpp/numeric/valarray/impl|atan}}

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;algorithm&gt;
#include &lt;cmath&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;valarray&gt;

auto show = [](char const* title, const std::valarray&lt;float&gt;&amp; va)
{
    std::cout &lt;&lt; title &lt;&lt; " :";
    std::for_each(std::begin(va), std::end(va), 
        [](const float x) { std::cout &lt;&lt; "  " &lt;&lt; std::fixed &lt;&lt; x; });
    std::cout &lt;&lt; '\n';
};

int main()
{
    const std::valarray&lt;float&gt; x = {.1f, .3f, .6f, .9f};
    const std::valarray&lt;float&gt; f = std::atan(x);
    const std::valarray&lt;float&gt; g = std::tan(f);

    show("x          ", x);
    show("f = atan(x)", f);
    show("g = tan(f) ", g);
}
|output=
x           :  0.100000  0.300000  0.600000  0.900000
f = atan(x) :  0.099669  0.291457  0.540420  0.732815
g = tan(f)  :  0.100000  0.300000  0.600000  0.900000
}}
